args: Splendid work, Rex—though I should\nhave expected no less from you.
To think one could dig a tunnel leading\nfrom the courtyard to a location outside\nthe castle walls with such ease!
Well, this is just splendid! Now we'll\nbe able to make a hasty retreat the\nmoment we see the enemy coming!
Well, shucks, fellas. Reckon I'm\njust glad yer takin' a fancy to it.
If there's anything else what I could do for\nya, don't think twice 'bout givin' yer good\npal Rex a holler.
You have my most profound gratitude.
And as for your offer, I would ask that you\nconstruct a secret passage that connects\nthe inside of the castle to the outside.
A truly inspired idea, my good man!\nOne can only benefit from having\nmultiple avenues of retreat.
Come then, Rex! Let me show you the\nlocation of my future panic room!
Do you mean to say you ALREADY have\nyour eye on a spot suited to the\nconstruction of a secret passageway?
＂Craven is as craven does,＂ as my dear\nmother used to say. ...Welp, let's get\nmoving—this tunnel won't dig itself!
The innermost room beneath the castle.\nIt also just so happens to be unused.

Hoo-ee! There's more'n enough room here
for me to work m'magic. Heck, there's even
space for me to pile up the dirt what I'll
be diggin' up!
Right then! Let's get this hoedown started!
Hold, friends. I understand the importance\nof striking when the iron is hot, but without\nproper tools and materials—

Two steps ahead of you there, pal.
I already went ahead and got everything
we'll need—it's waiting for us right now
beneath our very feet!
Well, slap my rump and call me a mule!\nThat's gonna be a heap'a help!\nNow lemme just... Hmm...
Say, gents? Which way do ya want\nthis tunnel'a yers pointin', anyhow?
I will defer to Alain in this matter,\nas I assume he already has a plan.
＂A＂ plan? You wound me! I have already\nconsidered roughly ONE HUNDRED\npossible avenues of retreat from here.
Gentlemen? From this room, we can create\nsplendid avenues of retreat in any and all\ncardinal directions!
Well, ain't that somethin'!\nEr, AIN'T it somethin', Jurota?
Amazing as those possibilities may be,\nI would remind you that the construction\ntime available to us is finite.
Pray let us focus on a single path of\negress that will be accessible to all.
Accessible to all... Oh, I see now!\nYou're thinking people may be injured\nor ill or something, right? Good point.
Plus, we have children and the elderly\nto consider as well... Yes, in that case,\nthere is only one clear choice:
We will create a passage that connects\nwith the forest to the east!
Its mighty trees will shield our visages\nfrom the eyes of all would-be pursuers.
Got a couple'a nice paths out in that\nforest, too. Seems like a humdinger of\na winner of an idea to me!
To think our path would be blocked by such\nan immense stone... Truly, fortune frowns\nupon us this day.
A'yup. Smashin' up a rock that big might\nbring the whole works down on our heads.
Hold yer horses there, friend. If we can't\nbust this here boulder up, we still might\nbe able to just dig the path 'round it.
Then let us do so; we have come much\ntoo far to turn back now.
Well, heck. This ain't good. I reckon we're\ncomin' up on an underground waterway.

Hmm. Well, if we make a route what for
the water to get out and then maybe
reinforce the walls a tick, I reckon we
could keep plowing forward.
Still, I can't swear the thing won't collapse\non our heads and flood the entire tunnel,\nso make'a that whatcha will.
What do you make of our predicament,\nAlain? ...Er, Alain? Where did he go?
Didn't he say he was gonna haul back\nall the dirt what we been scoopin' out?
He has been gone too long for that errand.\nPerhaps something hinders his return.
Aw, pig slop—that tremor put some real\nnasty cracks in m'support beams.\nBeat feet—this place is comin' down!
It just goes to show that you can never\nhave too many avenues of retreat.
Wait. Did you dig the hole what\nconnected this cave to our tunnel?
Thank you for asking! See, as I was\nreturning to join you, I came across a\nwall with a most conspicuous crack.
With a single flick of my fingers,\nthe whole thing came down and\ncreated a tunnel of nature's making.
An escape route within an escape route,\nas it were. Such things are often necessary\nin the name of the perfect getaway.
Well, it kept us from bein' smooshed\nunder a ton'a dirt'n rock, so ya got\nm'thanks no matter how it happened.
Back to business, then. Let us return to\nour task of digging the passageway.
After pressing forward for a time, the trio finds\nthemselves stopped in their tracks by a giant\nslab of most formidable bedrock.
Well, crud. I dunno, fellas. This bedrock\nhere's tougher than my ma's meatloaf.\nDon't reckon we'll be able to clear it.
We cannot proceed, and detours are\nnot an option. Have we truly no choice\nbut to turn back?
The heavens! Come, gentlemen—\nlet us turn our sights upward!
I know we've been detouring all over\nthe place, but I'll bet gold to gingerbread\nthat we've already cleared the castle!
Hmm. Are you certain of this?
Of course! Who would know better than\nme—a man who spent his life exploring\nevery facet of what it means to run away?
Ain't like we got much of a choice,\nso I'm willin' to give 'er a go.\nReady? One...two...HRNNNGGGGH!
This is...er... Well, it's a room.\nAt least there's no one here.
I fear these are the private chambers\nof Master {player_name}.

Wait, we went and dug ourselves into the
prince's dang BEDROOM?! Shucks, I hope
he don't hang us or whatever royalty does
when ya barge into their room...
Welp, no point gettin' hung up on it.\nLet's fill this in before anyone's the\nwiser and then skedadd—
No. We leave the hole as it is.
Didja get thumped on the noggin when\nthe tunnel collapsed? Why the heck would\nwe do somethin' like that?!
If we reveal this passage's existence to\nthe prince—and he alone—he could use it\nas an escape route in times of emergency.
Let us make the best of this situation.\nSurely this is the will of the heavens!
Huh. A private escape route for Prince\n{player_name}, is it?
Though we have strayed far from our\ninitial plan, I am pleased that our efforts\nhave still borne some fruit.
And with our mission complete, let us\ndepart this place; a shinobi such as\nmyself can only find peace in shadow.
And then let's feast it up to celebrate\nkeepin' {player_name} safe!
Well, well. Look what we have here...
